summary: Phase 1 change: apply the newly requested UI/content/feature updates ONLY to the ArthaNidhi Pay (User Portal) first, with NO data integration with the Admin Portal for now. User portal will include: new logo (replace everywhere) + updated footer copyright, global sunrise + neon sky-blue + peacock-feather mixed gradient background theme, full KYC form during signup with auto-approval if mandatory fields are filled, account view showing auto-generated Customer ID + Account Number (including auto-generation for existing users missing these), money transfer feature with real balance updates (using dummy/seed initial balances), updated dashboard greeting with username + local timezone date/time, move logout from dashboard into header (header-only), dark mode toggle across pages, left sidebar menu with all pages, dummy market/stocks/mutual-funds data, and a gold/silver rates module with dropdowns (Indian capital city, karat 18/22/24, weights 1g/10g/100g/1000g), plus a world+India financial news section (dummy).
architectural_notes: Site-wide header/footer shared across all pages with consistent ArthaNidhi Pay branding (name + logo).
Currency formatting should use INR (₹) for all monetary values displayed in the UI.

Internet Computer canisters cannot call external payment APIs; to support real payment gateways when running the code externally, use a Node.js (or other standard) backend that can make outbound HTTP calls, while keeping the React frontend.
Node.js backend implementation choice confirmed: CommonJS (require) style (e.g., server.js).
Planned external backend datastore: PostgreSQL connected from Node.js backend for users/accounts/transactions/transfers.
Node.js external REST backend folder should be named exactly `backend-node`.
Add a separate Admin Portal (separate frontend + backend) within the same repo, sharing branding/theme but isolated via its own environment configuration.
KYC-driven onboarding: users remain inactive until KYC is approved; if mandatory fields are completed, KYC can be auto-approved but still visible in admin.
On activation, auto-generate and persist unique IDs: Customer ID format `ARTHA` + 12 digits and a separate 16-digit Account Number.
Implement session inactivity timeout (5 minutes) with automatic logout for both user and admin portals.
known_issues: Existing user(s) (e.g., 'abc user') currently missing generated Customer ID and Account Number; must be backfilled automatically.
Gold/Silver Rates module not showing for existing user 'abc' (should render for all users).
Sidebar menu is appearing on the right instead of the requested left side.
Logout button is still displayed on the Dashboard; should be shown only in the header.
New logo replacement not yet applied consistently across all pages (should replace everywhere).
Logo asset selection is incorrect; user requests reverting to the previous logo (use the provided logo / previous logo consistently across the portal).
Signup: Full KYC form is still not showing during signup (should be visible and required per Phase 1 scope).
Visual theme: Background/gradient currently applied is not the earlier agreed background color/theme; revert to the earlier background and do not use the current gradient.
Gold & Silver Rates: The Gold/Silver rates module/page is still not showing (user reports it missing; should be visible for all authenticated users).
Background/theme should be a stunning, consistent background across all pages (user reiterates request to apply it everywhere).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Premium dark-mode fintech abstract background in deep navy and charcoal with soft gradients, gentle glow lines, subtle blue/white accents, and minimal saffron/green highlights; high contrast; no text/logos/people/watermarks (banking-bg-dark-india.dim_3840x2160.png)

existing_features.title: Create a consistent, stunning, user-friendly visual theme for the ArthaNidhi Pay website (colors, typography, spacing, components) and apply it across all pages without using a blue+purple primary palette.

Generate required brand images (logo and optional hero/illustrations) and include them as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated, then render them in the UI where appropriate (header/footer and key pages).
Implement global navigation chrome: a Header and Footer rendered on all pages, showing the ArthaNidhi Pay name and logo, plus a Footer section containing an English disclaimer and a copyright line.
Add authentication flows using Internet Identity: Signup page (onboarding details captured after first login), Login page, and protected routes that require the user to be authenticated.

Add a "Forgot password" link on the Login page that navigates to a dedicated Forgot Password page explaining that account recovery is handled via Internet Identity and providing clear user guidance (English-only copy).

Create the Home/Dashboard page for ArthaNidhi Pay showing a high-level overview (e.g., total balance, recent activity summary, quick links to Account, Statements, Market Insights) and include a Logout button on the Dashboard.

Create the Account page that presents account details and renders Financial Health visualizations including at least one pie chart and one additional chart (e.g., line/bar) based on the user’s transactions/budget categories.
Create the Balance Inquiry / Statement page that lists transactions with filtering (date range and type credit/debit at minimum) and shows current/available balance.

Create the Market Insight page showing market summary cards and simple charts/tables using backend-provided mock market data (no external API calls), and include clear labeling that data is informational only.

Add at least three additional user-friendly features appropriate for a banking dashboard (selected and implemented end-to-end) without adding external integrations: (1) transaction search by keyword, (2) downloadable statement export (CSV) generated client-side from fetched transactions, and (3) in-app profile/settings page (e.g., update display name, toggle light/dark mode).

Update the app branding to match the uploaded reference images by (a) replacing the currently used logo with the provided logo artwork, and (b) applying a background style consistent with the reference (light surface with soft wave accents) across key unauthenticated and authenticated pages (Login, Signup, Dashboard, Market Insights, Mutual Funds, Stocks).

Switch all currency display in the frontend from USD formatting to INR formatting using the ₹ symbol, including balance, statements, dashboard summary numbers, and market-related prices; ensure number formatting uses Indian locale conventions where appropriate (e.g., en-IN).

Revise Market Insights to be India-focused using backend-provided mock data (no external APIs): replace current global/crypto tickers with Indian-market symbols and labels (e.g., NIFTY 50, SENSEX, major NSE/BSE-listed equities), and keep the existing “Informational only / simulated data” disclaimer in English.

Add a new protected Mutual Funds page focused on Indian mutual funds using backend-provided mock data (no external APIs), including a list/table of funds with key fields (fund name, category, NAV/price, 1D change, 1Y return as mock values) and a short English disclaimer that values are simulated.

Add a new protected Stocks page focused on Indian stocks using backend-provided mock data (no external APIs), including a list/table of stocks with key fields (symbol, company name, last price in ₹, daily change), and integrate navigation links to Market Insights, Mutual Funds, and Stocks in the global header/menu.

Add a frontend-side backend abstraction that can switch between the current Internet Computer actor backend and an external REST backend, controlled by a single environment/config flag (e.g., `VITE_BACKEND_MODE=ic|rest`).

Update the React Query hooks in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` to use the new backend abstraction so that the app can function with either IC actor calls or REST calls, without changing page components.

Provide a clear REST API contract (endpoint list + request/response JSON shapes) and local VS Code run instructions so the user can implement a Node.js/Express backend externally that matches the frontend’s expected behavior.

Update the frontend documentation to clearly explain how to run the exported project locally in VS Code for both backend modes (IC and REST), including exact commands, required tooling versions, and where to place the `.env` file; ensure all user-facing text is in English.

Complete `frontend/REST_BACKEND_CONTRACT.md` so it fully documents the REST API required by the existing `frontend/src/backendClient/restClient.ts` implementation, including endpoint list, HTTP methods, required headers, request/response JSON shapes (including how bigint values are represented), error shapes, and authentication/session expectations.

Add standardized file header comments across the codebase (backend Motoko and frontend TypeScript/TSX) that describe each file’s purpose, key responsibilities, and any important constraints; do not add excessive line-by-line comments that reduce readability.

Update the project documentation to clearly answer whether the currently provided code and run instructions are intended for development or production use, including explicit guidance on what would be required to run in production (e.g., environment variables, security/auth expectations, and any "demo/local" limitations) using English-only user-facing text.

Standardize all documentation references to the external REST backend folder name as exactly "backend-node" (including any run commands and folder structure references), and ensure the instructions consistently reflect running the frontend and the external backend side-by-side in VS Code.

Create a separate Admin Portal frontend within the same repository, isolated from the existing ArthaNidhi Pay user frontend, with its own routes, auth pages, and layout while reusing the same ArthaNidhi visual background style (light surface with soft wave accents).

Add separate environment configuration for the Admin Portal so it can be built/run with admin-specific environment variables (including dev/stage/prod separation if already present for the user portal), without breaking the existing user portal environment setup.

Implement regular (non–Internet Identity) authentication flows for BOTH the user portal and the admin portal: signup, login, logout, session persistence, and access-controlled protected routes appropriate to each portal.

Add a Forgot Password link on the login page for BOTH the user portal and the admin portal, each leading to a dedicated password recovery/reset flow that works with the regular signup/login system (not Internet Identity).

Provide a batch-oriented delivery plan in-repo (developer-facing documentation) for generating/working with the code in ordered batches as requested (option 1: entire project in multiple ordered batches), including a clear sequence of which folders/files belong to user portal vs admin portal.

Update and complete the repository documentation so a developer can run the project locally in VS Code using npm for both frontend and backend, with copy-paste commands for: (1) Internet Computer (Motoko) backend + User Portal frontend in IC mode, and (2) User Portal frontend in REST mode with an external backend (referenced as the "backend-node" folder, per existing docs).

Add explicit Dev and Staging environment setup for the User Portal using Vite environment files and document the corresponding URLs for each environment (local URLs are acceptable). Provide example environment files and instructions to run each mode via npm scripts/commands.

Add GitHub onboarding instructions to the documentation: how to initialize a repo, add a remote, push to GitHub, and how to configure environment files safely (e.g., keep `.env` out of git). Include a clearly marked placeholder for the user’s GitHub repository URL (do not hardcode an unknown URL).

Provide a VS Code-friendly setup in-repo to make local development straightforward (workspace recommendations and basic guidance), without requiring proprietary extensions. If adding config files (e.g., `.vscode`), ensure they work for running the User Portal and do not change any immutable frontend paths.

Ensure the User Portal Dashboard renders a visible "Gold & Silver Rates" dummy-data section for all authenticated users (including existing users), with dropdown controls for (1) Indian capital city, (2) karat 18/22/24, and (3) weight 1g/10g/100g/1000g, and display calculated dummy prices in INR (₹) based on the selected options.

Fix the User Portal logo so that the correct ArthaNidhi Pay logo artwork is used consistently across the User Portal UI (at minimum: header and footer), replacing the currently referenced logo asset path(s) where needed.

Add the uploaded logo design as the canonical ArthaNidhi Pay logo asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and update the User Portal UI to use this same logo consistently anywhere a logo is shown (at minimum: Header and Footer, and the Login page illustration/logo).

Add the uploaded image (Screenshot 2026-02-06 012037-4.png) as the canonical ArthaNidhi Pay logo static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and update the User Portal UI to use this new logo everywhere a logo is shown (at minimum: global Header and Footer; include any auth pages that display a logo).

Revert the User Portal background styling to the earlier agreed background color/theme (do not use the current multi-color gradient background), and apply the reverted background consistently across unauthenticated and authenticated User Portal pages.

Ensure the full KYC section is rendered and required during User Portal signup (i.e., KYC fields are visible on the Signup page and validated before account creation), and ensure the KYC data is persisted with the user profile so it can be retrieved after signup.

Fix Gold & Silver Rates visibility by ensuring it is accessible and visible to authenticated users: (1) the dashboard must render the Gold & Silver Rates module reliably for all authenticated users, and (2) add a dedicated protected Gold & Silver Rates page/route if the UI currently expects a separate page.

Implement a LEFT-side persistent navigation menu (sidebar) in the ArthaNidhi Pay User Portal authenticated layout that lists the main protected pages (Dashboard, Account, Statements, Market Insights, Mutual Funds, Stocks, Gold & Silver Rates, Profile/Settings) and works responsively (collapsible/drawer on small screens).

Move the User Portal logout control so it is available in the global Header user menu (or equivalent header control) and remove/hide any Logout button currently rendered on the Dashboard page content area.
Update the User Portal Dashboard header area to greet the authenticated user by their name (or display name) and show the current local date/time (based on the user's browser timezone).

Add a "News" section to the User Portal Dashboard that shows a mixed "World" and "India" finance news feed using simulated/mock items (no external API calls), and clearly label it as simulated/demo content in English.

Implement a dummy-but-consistent money transfer feature in the User Portal that allows transferring INR amounts between two users within the system, and updates both users’ balances and transaction/transfer history accordingly.
Ensure every User Portal account has a generated Customer ID and Account Number, and backfill them automatically for existing users who are missing these fields; display them on the Account page.

Update the User Portal footer attribution/copyright text to remove any mention of "Built with" and "caffeine.ai", and replace it with exactly: "© 2026 belongs to ArthaNidhi Pay and built by Arunachalam Data Management."

Ensure all User Portal users (existing and new) have (a) an auto-generated Customer ID and Account Number if missing, and (b) the same dummy initial balance applied consistently, so that transfers/transactions update balances and the monthly credit/debit charts accordingly.
Modernize the User Portal background color and overall UI styling so it no longer looks visually odd, while keeping styling consistent across unauthenticated and authenticated User Portal pages.

Generate a premium, high-resolution dark-mode website background image suitable for an Indian digital banking/fintech UI, using deep navy blue and charcoal tones as the base, subtle accents of blue and white, and very minimal saffron or green highlights; include soft gradients, gentle glow lines, and minimal abstract elements representing finance, growth, digital payments, and secure transactions; ensure the image contains no people, no text, no logos, and no watermarks.

Apply the newly generated dark-mode banking background image across the ArthaNidhi Pay User Portal in dark mode (unauthenticated and authenticated pages), ensuring readable contrast for all primary UI surfaces (cards, tables, form fields, and navigation) while keeping the background subtle and non-distracting.
